com.bigdata.rdf.sail.sparql

Class TestReificationDoneRightParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • com.bigdata.rdf.sparql.AbstractBigdataExprBuilderTestCase
          • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.sparql.TestReificationDoneRightParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class TestReificationDoneRightParser
extends AbstractBigdataExprBuilderTestCase
    Test suite for the proposed standardization of "reification done right".
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson TODO When triple pattern reference is nested within a GRAPH ?g {} clause (verify that the graph context is inherited correctly). TODO Test recursive embedded at depth GT 1.
    See Also:
    (Reification done right)

      • test_triple_ref_pattern_var_const_const

        public void test_triple_ref_pattern_var_const_const()
                                             throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                    TokenMgrError,
                                                    ParseException
        Unit test for a triple reference pattern using an explicit BIND(). 
         prefix : 
 prefix dc: 
 SELECT ?src ?who {
    BIND( <> AS ?sid ) .
    ?sid dc:source ?src .
 }
        is translated as 
         SP( ?who, :bought, :sybase) AS ?sid .
 SP( ?sid, dc:source, ?src )
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException

                                                                            TokenMgrError,
                                                                            ParseException
        Unit test verifies that blank nodes may not appear in a triple pattern reference (the semantics of this are explicitly ruled out by the extension).
        Throws:

      • test_triple_ref_pattern_no_vars

        public void test_triple_ref_pattern_no_vars()
                                     throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                            TokenMgrError,
                                            ParseException
        Unit test for a triple reference pattern without variables. There is an implicit variable which must be assigned when we translate this construct. 
         prefix : 
 prefix dc: 
 SELECT ?src ?who {
    <<:SAP :bought :sybase>> dc:source ?src
 }
        The triple reference pattern must be translated as if it had been expressed with an explicit variable using BIND(). The equivalent expression for that triple reference pattern is: 
         SP(:SAP :bought :sybase) as ?sid) .
 SP(?sid dc:source ?src) .
        The BIND() of the triple reference pattern is itself translated into a StatementPatternNode where the ?sid variable appears in the SID role of that StatementPatternNode.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException

      • test_triple_ref_pattern_nested_in_subject_position

        public void test_triple_ref_pattern_nested_in_subject_position()
                                                        throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                               TokenMgrError,
                                                               ParseException
        A unit test when the triple reference pattern recursively embeds another triple reference pattern in the subject position. The nesting needs to be unpacked into a series of SP( <<...>> AS ?sidVar) expressions. 
         prefix : 
 SELECT ?a ?e {
    BIND( << <> :d ?e >> as ?sid ) 
 }
        Should be translated as : 
         SP(?a, :b, :c) as ?sid1 .
 SP(?sid1, :d, :e) as ?sid .
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException

      • test_triple_ref_pattern_nested_in_object_position

        public void test_triple_ref_pattern_nested_in_object_position()
                                                       throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                              TokenMgrError,
                                                              ParseException
        A unit test when the triple reference pattern recursively embeds another triple reference pattern in the object position. The nesting needs to be unpacked into a series of SP(s,p,o) AS ?sidVar expressions. 
         prefix : 
 SELECT ?a ?e {
    BIND( << ?a :d <> >> as ?sid ) 
 }
        Should be translated as : 
         SP(?e, :b, :c) as ?sid1 .
 SP(?a, :d, ?sid1) as ?sid .
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException

      • test_triple_ref_pattern_is_constant

        public void test_triple_ref_pattern_is_constant()
                                         throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                TokenMgrError,
                                                ParseException
        A unit test when the triple reference pattern is a constant. 
         prefix : 
 SELECT ?a {
    BIND( <<:e :b :c>> >> as ?sid ) .
    ?a :d ?sid . 
 }
        Should be translated as : 
         SP(:e, :b, :c) as ?sid .
 SP(?a, :d, ?sid).
        Note that the SP for the fully bound triple pattern will enforce the semantics that the triple must exist in the data in order for the query to succeed.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException

      • test_triple_ref_pattern_all_vars

        public void test_triple_ref_pattern_all_vars()
                                      throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                             TokenMgrError,
                                             ParseException
        A unit test when the triple reference pattern is a constant. 
         prefix : 
 SELECT ?a {
    ?d ?e <> . 
 }
        Should be translated as : 
         SP(?a, ?b, ?c) as ?sid-1 .
 SP(?d, ?e, ?-sid-1).
        Note that the SP for the first bound triple pattern will enforce the semantics that the triple must exist in the data in order for the query to succeed.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException

      • test_triple_ref_pattern_all_vars2

        public void test_triple_ref_pattern_all_vars2()
                                       throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                              TokenMgrError,
                                              ParseException
        A unit test when the triple reference pattern is a constant. 
         prefix : 
 SELECT ?a {
    <> ?d ?e . 
 }
        Should be translated as : 
         SP(?a, ?b, ?c) as ?sid-1 .
 SP(?-sid-1, ?d, ?e).
        Note that the SP for the first bound triple pattern will enforce the semantics that the triple must exist in the data in order for the query to succeed.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException

      • test_triple_ref_pattern_all_vars_with_explicit_bind

        public void test_triple_ref_pattern_all_vars_with_explicit_bind()
                                                         throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                                                TokenMgrError,
                                                                ParseException
        A unit test when the triple reference pattern is a constant. 
         prefix : 
 SELECT ?a {
    BIND( <> as ?sid ) .
    ?d ?e ?sid . 
 }
        Should be translated as : 
         SP(?a, ?b, ?c) as ?sid .
 SP(?d, ?e, ?sid).
        Note that the SP for the first bound triple pattern will enforce the semantics that the triple must exist in the data in order for the query to succeed.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException

      • test_update_insert_data_RDR

        public void test_update_insert_data_RDR()
                                 throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException,
                                        TokenMgrError,
                                        ParseException
         INSERT DATA {
   <:s> <:p> "d" .
   <<<:s> <:p> "d">> <:order> 5 .
 }
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        TokenMgrError
        ParseException
        See Also:
        RDFnot parsed in SPARQL UPDATE TODO Write DELETE DATA test case for RDR as well.
